meanings.definition: The act of changing direction or position
meanings.sent1: The turnings of the car on the road were smooth and gradual.
meanings.sent2: I missed the turnings to the park because the sign was hidden.
meanings.sent3: The GPS kept telling us to make strange turnings, leading us in circles.
meanings.sent4: In life, we often face unexpected turnings that challenge us to adapt.
meanings.sent5: The turnings of the river created a beautiful landscape.

meanings.definition: A curve or bend in a road or path
meanings.sent1: The road's sharp turnings made driving difficult.
meanings.sent2: The turnings in the hiking trail offered stunning views of the valley.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel made quick turnings to avoid the chasing cat.
meanings.sent4: The turnings of fate brought them together in unexpected ways.
meanings.sent5: The turnings of the maze confused the participants.

meanings.definition: The action of rotating around an axis
meanings.sent1: The turnings of the wheel propelled the bicycle forward.
meanings.sent2: The dancer's graceful turnings captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The turnings of the windmill generated electricity for the farm.
meanings.sent4: The turnings of the Earth create day and night for us.
meanings.sent5: The turnings of the gears kept the clock ticking.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming different or taking a different course
meanings.sent1: The company's recent turnings have led to increased profits.
meanings.sent2: After the argument, their relationship took unexpected turnings.
meanings.sent3: The novel's plot had so many turnings, it was hard to predict the ending.
meanings.sent4: The turnings of history often shape the future in surprising ways.
meanings.sent5: The turnings of the seasons bring changes in nature.
